alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 9:45AM CDT until June 08 at 12:28AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-080245- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.W.0008.220607T1448Z-220608T0528Z/ /BRIO2.1.ER.220607T1448Z.220607T1800Z.220607T2327Z.NO/ 945 AM CDT Tue Jun 7 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Middle and upper bottomlands may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 15.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
